title: Roasted Kabocha Squash With Soy Sauce, Butter, and Shichimi Togarashi Recipe
full_text:
Roasted Kabocha Squash With Soy Sauce, Butter, and Shichimi Togarashi Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Cook
30 mins
Active
5 mins
Total
35 mins
Serves
4 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1
large
skin-on kabocha squash
, seeded and cut into 1-inch cubes (about
2
pounds
)
1
tablespoon
soy sauce
2
tablespoons
butter
1/2
teaspoon
shichimi togarashi
(see notes)
Kosher salt
Directions
Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat oven to 400°F. In a small saucepan or microwaveable bowl, combine soy sauce and butter and heat until melted. Place squash in a large bowl and drizzle with soy sauce/butter mixture and togarashi.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Spread the squash in an even layer on a parchment-lined, rimmed baking sheet. Make sure there is a bit of space between each piece so that they can brown and cook evenly from all sides.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Transfer to oven and roast until tender and starting to brown gently, 20 to 25 minutes.
Season to taste with salt (if necessary) and serve immediately.
Note
Shichimi togarashi is a Japanese seven spice blend.
Vegetable Sides
Japanese
Vegetarian Sides
Roasted Vegetables
Kabocha Squash
